org.mrpdaemon.sec.encfs

Class EncFSVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mrpdaemon.sec.encfs.EncFSVolume

  • public class EncFSVolume
extends Object
    Class representing an EncFS volume.

    The volume is defined by a root folder, which contains an EncFS configuration file and a hierarchy of encrypted files and subdirectories created by a compliant EncFS implementation.

      • getFile

        public EncFSFile getFile(String filePath)
                  throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                         IOException
        Get an EncFSFile object representing the provided absolute path in the volume
        Parameters:
        filePath - Absolute volume path of the file
        Returns:
        EncFSFile representing the requested file
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException - Corrupt data detected (checksum error)
        IOException - File provider returned I/O error

      • getDecryptedFileLength

        public long getDecryptedFileLength(long encryptedFileLength)
        Returns the decrypted length a file would have in this volume given its encrypted length
        Parameters:
        encryptedFileLength - Length of the encrypted file
        Returns:
        Length of the file after decryption

      • getEncryptedFileLength

        Parameters:
        decryptedFileLength - Length of the decrypted file
        Returns:
        Length of the file after encryption

      • pathExists

        public boolean pathExists(String path)
                   throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                          IOException
        Checks whether the file or directory with the given path exists in the volume
        Parameters:
        path - Absolute volume path of the file or directory
        Returns:
        true if path exists in the volume, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException - Filename encoding failed
        IOException - File provider returned I/O error

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                            IOException

        Parameters:
        parentPath - Absolute volume path of the parent directory
        fileName - Name of the file to create
        Returns:
        EncFSFile handle for the newly created file
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException - Filename encoding failed
        EncFSChecksumException - Filename encoding failed

      • makeDirs

        public boolean makeDirs(String dirPath)
                 throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                        IOException

        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException

      • deletePath

        public boolean deletePath(String filePath,
                 boolean recursive,
                 EncFSProgressListener progressListener)
                   throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                          IOException
        Deletes the given file or directory in the EncFS volume
        Parameters:
        filePath - Absolute volume path of the file/directory to delete
        recursive - Whether to recursively delete directories. Without this option deletePath will fail to delete non-empty directories
        progressListener - Progress listener for getting individual file updates
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        IOException

      • deletePath

      • openInputStreamForPath

        public EncFSInputStream openInputStreamForPath(String filePath)
                                        throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                               EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                               IOException
        Opens the specified file as an EncFSInputStream that decrypts the file contents automatically
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        EncFSUnsupportedException
        IOException

      • openOutputStreamForPath

        public EncFSOutputStream openOutputStreamForPath(String filePath,
                                        long outputLength)
                                          throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                                 EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                                 IOException
        Opens the specified file as an EncFSOutputStream that encrypts the file contents automatically
        Parameters:
        filePath - Absolute volume path of the file
        outputLength - Length of the output data that will be written to the returned output stream. Note that this parameter is optional if using EncFSLocalFileProvider, but some network based storage API's require knowing the file length in advance.
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        EncFSUnsupportedException
        IOException
